name: Cirrus
description: Thin and wispy clouds often appearing like feathers high in the sky.

name: Cumulus
description: Large, white, fluffy clouds with a flat base and rounded tops often resembling cotton balls.

name: Stratus
description: Low-lying clouds that are often gray or white, covering the entire sky and resembling a blanket.

name: Cirrostratus
description: High, thin clouds that cover the sky like a veil and often indicate a change in weather.

name: Altocumulus
description: Mid-level clouds that are often gray or white with rounded edges and resemble fish scales.

name: Nimbostratus
description: Dark, gray clouds that cover the entire sky and often bring prolonged rain or snow.

name: Cirrocumulus
description: Small, rounded, white clouds that appear in long rows and often indicate a change in weather.

name: Altocumulus Castellanus
description: Mid-level clouds that have vertical towers or pinnacles on their top edges, resembling a castle.

name: Stratocumulus
description: Low-lying clouds that are often gray or white with a puffy appearance and can resemble waves in the sky.

name: Cumulonimbus
description: Thunderstorm clouds that are tall, dark, and can produce lightning, heavy rain, and strong winds.
